channel.title: The next Great Depression for America?
channel.description:
I'm sure most of you have heard about this. americas economy is in crisis. Big companies are now fileing chapter 11 bankrupcy such as Fannie and Bernie Mac and now even AIG is falling.
What do you think will become of this?
Discuss.

item.title: The next Great Depression for America?
item.dc:creator: @maniown maniown
item.description:
@maniown wrote:

[quote=“army_life, post:29, topic:233593”][quote author=maniown link=topic=308055.msg2472465#msg2472465 date=1223077058]
They ow Billions of dollars to THE PEOPLE. In my opinion giving a percentage to everybody over 18 in America would do some good.
[/quote]

The government is curropted no doubt they are in a way trying to help but being the republicans that most of them are giving more to the rich hopefully spreading to lower classes and everythings fine which simply is not the case and if Mccain/Palin get elected… we may see the 2nd revolution probably not with violence (A king movement) or a recession followed by the economy just totally collapsing then the country will fall. Are economy is bad but not recession bad…yet.[/quote]

We almoust need a 2nd depression to straighten this fail of a country out.

Read full topic

bush thinks he can have the treasurey make more cash so the dollar drops so anyrhing inported rises so people csnt buy new stuff so companies lose cash and have to get loans, so i blame bush he fucked up

You are quite a spelling bee, arn’t you? And then again, what you are saying is complete bullshit. Yes, Bush did fuck up, but he didn’t do it on purpose. When will people realise that tax money isn’t going into the pockets of the government.

item.source: The next Great Depression for America?

item.title: The next Great Depression for America?
item.dc:creator: @dragonfire455 dragonfire455
item.description:
@dragonfire455 wrote:

[quote=“Uriko, post:19, topic:233593”][quote author=R.I.P RSC link=topic=308055.msg2463673#msg2463673 date=1222611095]
I had a feeling you would say something like that, but wasn’t sure so I asked.

It can’t go bankrupt, because it’s the only bank that can create money. It’s almost the same as the European central bank, which is the parent of the Swedish/Dutch/German/Belgain/etc… Central bank. In Europe it’s a bit different, because there are multiple countries. But in the U.S you only have the central bank. As I said it creates money and lends it to private banks. That means that they decide what the percentage of interest the banks should use (they can change it a bit, but not with 10 percentage points). So they are also the only institute that can change the inflation, by either raising or lowering the interest. If the central bank was there to make big profits, they’d just create more of it. It’s comparable to a non-profit organisation.
[/quote]It doesn’t work that way, like after the first world war, Germany was in debt so much that they had to keep creating money, which made their currency less. You can’t just keep making money and expect to see no change in your currency.

Btw gas is about $1.13 here/per litre[/quote]5-6 bucks where I live (where is all the good oil these days :P)

Read full topic
item.source: The next Great Depression for America?

In Europe it’s a bit different, because there are multiple countries. But in the U.S you only have the central bank. As I said it creates money and lends it to private banks. That means that they decide what the percentage of interest the banks should use (they can change it a bit, but not with 10 percentage points). So they are also the only institute that can change the inflation, by either raising or lowering the interest. If the central bank was there to make big profits, they’d just create more of it. It’s comparable to a non-profit organisation.[/quote]It doesn’t work that way, like after the first world war, Germany was in debt so much that they had to keep creating money, which made their currency less. item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

I had a feeling you would say something like that, but wasn’t sure so I asked.

It can’t go bankrupt, because it’s the only bank that can create money. It’s almost the same as the European central bank, which is the parent of the Swedish/Dutch/German/Belgain/etc… Central bank. In Europe it’s a bit different, because there are multiple countries. But in the U.S you only have the central bank. As I said it creates money and lends it to private banks. That means that they decide what the percentage of interest the banks should use (they can change it a bit, but not with 10 percentage points). So they are also the only institute that can change the inflation, by either raising or lowering the interest. If the central bank was there to make big profits, they’d just create more of it. It’s comparable to a non-profit organisation.

item.title: The next Great Depression for America?
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:13, topic:233593”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=308055.msg2463571#msg2463571 date=1222606475]
Now let’s come to the real question. As you can see, “all” banks have crashed in america. Now, take a good look at the central bank and i think you will find something very interesting…
[/quote]

Elaborate please?[/quote]sigh i wanted you to research it yourself. It’s the ONLY bank that has not crashed, and never will. Why? Because they are behind the inflation. They were behind all the major inflations in America (watergate, the great depression etc). Since they control the economy they can do what they want, and by doing this, they can make even more money.

Read full topic

It’s all because of George W. Faggot having the troops over in Iraq, it’s costing 4 billion (don’t quote me on that, someone find the exact price please) a week just to keep them over there. Quite frankly, the sooner Australia has nothing to do with America, the better. American’s are fucking idiots, and have done it to themselves, the world hates them, they hate themselves, and worst of all - Iraq hates them.
[/quote]I agree on everything you said except the “everybody hates america” part because that is not true.

Although people are entitled to their opinions that one went too fat.[/quote]
So it went too American?
